result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert A Green

9:58 AM Defendant Albert A Green in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Albert A Green.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has  received discovery.
Defense requests time to negotiate.
Court will set for a projected plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:11 AM Defendant Albert A Green in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:49 PM Defendant Albert A Green in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang for attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Griffis

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:05 PM Defendant Albert A Green in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
